title: IMF releases new World Economic Outlook -- live | Business | The Guardian
summary: niesr : uk growth slowed to 0.7 % in q3 2014
imf : emerging economies must watch out when fed raises rates .
imf : ecb 's asset purchase scheme can make a difference .
imf 's three risks : search for yield , geopolitics , the eurozone .
imf 's blanchard : us and uk lead the way as eurozone lags .

text: back to greece where the finance minister has been forced to deny auditors representing the country 's troika '' of creditors have abruptly ended their latest inspection tour .

from athens helena smith writes : finance minister gikas hardouvelis denied that mission chiefs from the eu , ecb and imf had cut short their review of the greek economy because of disagreement on an array of issues .
everyone wants greece to succeed and for that reason they will support the greek government , '' he said .
it goes without saying that the government will continue implementing reforms . ''
greek finance minister gikas hardouvelis at a business conference in athens .

photo : reuters/alkis konstantinidis earlier in the day media reports suggested that troika officials had packed their bags in a fit of pique because neither side could agree on the incendiary matter of non performing loans - and a government budget that auditors regard as overly optimistic for 2015 .
at €75bn , greek banks have the highest non performing loans in europe .
the officials , who had been due to leave greece later this week , will now return in november once stress tests have been conducted on the debt-burdened nation 's banks .
one insider said with the government facing a crucial vote of confidence later this week - and a debate set to begin tomorrow - it was deemed more diplomatic '' if the negotiators disappeared .
more than at any other time athens needs to conclude talks with the bodies keeping its economy afloat if it wants to act on its pledge to exit its eu/imf bailout by the end of the year .
under intense political pressure from an increasingly popular anti-austerity opposition , prime minister antonis samaras has repeatedly said that exiting the programme has become his top priority .
ahead of talks with samaras this evening , evangelos venizelos , the coalition government 's deputy leader , announced that greece had entered a critical period where much was at risk of being lost .
the next months will be decisive for the decades ahead , '' he told the second annual meeting of greek entrepreneurs .
the achievements of the past five years could be lost in five days , '' he said referring to the political uncertainty that has hung over greece with talk of early elections .
the confidence vote was called to defuse speculation of snap polls .

but with yields on greek bonds rising in recent weeks and the athens stock exchange falling in afternoon trade , investors clearly fear a period of prolonged political paralysis has returned to haunt greece .
on that note , it 's time to close down for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back again tomorrow .

documents.title: markets tumble once more
text: a combination of economic growth fears and worries about the spread of the ebola virus , not to mention continuing geopolitical concerns in hong kong , ukraine and syria , helped sent stock markets lower again , writes nick fletcher .

travel companies were hit by the news that an ebola case had been confirmed in spain , while worse than expected german industrial production figures and the imf cutting its global growth forecasts unsettled investors once more .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished 68.07 points or 1.04 % lower at 6495.58 germany 's dax dropped 1.34 % to 9086.21 france 's cac closed down 1.81 % at 4209.14 italy 's ftse mib fell 1.73 % to 19,771.71 spain 's ibex ended down 2.02 % at 10,430.7 ( after the ebola news ) in the us , the dow jones industrial average is currently 131 points or 0,77 % lower .
over in greece , the campaign by cleaning ladies fired last year as part of the government 's deregulation of labour laws continues .
helena smith reports : despite the rain and their ongoing court battles with the greek state , the women who have become the emblems of austerity 's injustice are in robust mood .
we are not going to back down and have lots more surprises in store , '' said despoina kostopoulou , the cleaners ' unofficial spokeswoman .
we wo n't relent until we are reinstated in the jobs that we wrongly lost . ''
the women said they had derived great strength and courage '' from a letter of solidarity the british film director ken loach had sent them on hearing of their plight .
protesing greek cleaners .
photo : helena smith here 's the ken loach letter : dear friends , i have heard of your situation from friends in england .
what a story !
your strength and determination to fight for real jobs with fair wages is inspiring .
we have many stories like yours here , as i 'm sure you know .
the constant pressure to privatise our public services is destroying the services and bringing poverty and insecurity to working people .
the european union and big corporations , supported by the politicians , are formidable enemies .
but you too are formidable !
we need to support each other , as you say .
paul laverty , who writes our film scripts , including bread & roses , will be in athens at the end of october for a couple of days ( 25 - 27th oct ) .
he may have a busy schedule at the film festival then , but he hopes he can meet with you then .
in the meantime , everyone here sends their greetings , solidarity and warmest good wishes .
yours sincerely , ken loach

back with the imf world economic outlook , tuc general secretary frances o'grady alights on the fund 's comments on investment for growth , saying : the imf 's research shows why austerity is failing across europe and we have the slowest recovery from a crash on record .

waiting for growth to turn up is not enough , we need concerted government action to improve living standards in both britain and our eu neighbours through investment in jobs , infrastructure , skills and wage packets .
without such action living standards will fail to recover .

and complacent governments seem to want to go back to pre-crash business as usual , despite the worrying signs we can see already of house prices surging , an unreformed finance sector and household debts rising again .
only public investment and a strong industrial policy will give us a rebalanced economy that can deliver for all .
the tuc 's frances o'grady .
photo : reuters/phil noble
commodities giant glencore has just released a statement saying it is no longer actively considering '' a merger with rio tinto .
it comes a day after bloomberg reported that glencore was considering a tie-up in 2015 , prompting rio to say it had rejected the deal .

glencore says : glencore announces that in july 2014 it made an informal enquiry by telephone call to rio tinto , seeking to gauge whether there might be any interest at rio tinto in investigating some form of merger between the two companies .
rio tinto responded that it was not interested in pursuing these discussions .
glencore confirms that it is no longer actively considering any possible merger transaction with , or offer for the shares of , rio tinto .
so , that means glencore can not now bid for rio for six months , unless another company launches a bid or rio does a u-turn and agrees a deal .
or unless there is a material change in circumstances . ''
so the deal may not be sunk for ever lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) mulling ?
rt @ twitterid : .
@ fastft : glencore not `` actively considering '' rio tinto deal

documents.title: niesr : uk growth slowed to 0.7 % in q3 2014
text: just in uk growth slowed to 0.7 % in the third quarter of this year , from 0.9 % in the april-june quarter .
that 's according to the national institute of economic and social research 's monthly estimate .
my colleague angela monaghan has the details : the think tank 's estimate is in tune with other recent data suggesting the recovery is losing some of its momentum in the second half of the year .
the broader message from niesr however is do n't panic , it 's still a story of recovery in the uk and although there are a number of risks , none of them have materialised as yet .
simon kirby , principal research fellow , says : growth rates move around from quarter to quarter .
we should n't be surprised to see growth moderate somewhat from the very robust rate in the preceding quarter .
it 's a story of continuing economic recovery . ''
we will have to wait until 24 october for the first official estimate of third quarter growth from the office for national statistics .
the news that the imf had cut its growth forecast , added to this morning 's tumble in german industrial activity , send shares falling on wall street .
the dow jones fell 135 points in early trading .
cnbc now ( @ cnbcnow ) markets now » dow falls 130 points , s & p loses 15 and nasdaq sheds 36 .

documents.title: imf : emerging economies must watch out when fed raises rates
text: and finally , a question about american monetary policy - when does the imf think us interest rates will rise , and what impact will that have on the rest of the world ?
gian maria milesi-ferretti , imf deputy director , says that the imf expects the us recovery will continue this year and in 2015 .
that means that the fund expects the federal reserve will start to raise interest rates , maybe around the middle of next year .
we expect that the normalisation of us interest rates will be positive for emerging markets , but policymakers need to watch for bumps along the way , he concludes .
and that 's the end of the press conference .
what is the main priority for japan in the next 6 to 12 months ?
the challenge that japan has is very clear , blanchard replies .
they can not let their debt/gdp levels rise , so they need fiscal consolidation .
but they also need growth - either through exports , or through improved private demand and domestic consumption .
and the news here is mixed '' .
the weak yen has not , yet , boosted exports , and the recent sales tax has hit demand .
what does the imf think of the plan , from the eu 's new president jean-claude juncker , for a major €300bn investment plan ?
infrastructure investment in europe is a great idea , olivier blanchard says , as many countries need better infrastructure and there are many people out work .
but how it is funded that 's up to the eu
how can spain avoid deflation ?
blanchard replies that the imf is relieved that the spanish economy is achieving growth , although it could be stronger , and it hopes that spain will avoid full-blown deflation .
the press conference turns to low-income countries sub-sahara africa ; what 's the imf 's view for them ?
rupa duttagupta , imf deputy division chief , replies the the imf expects another year of strong growth , over 5 % , in the region .
but the outbreak of ebola has hit three countries hard - sierra leone , liberia and guinea , duttagupta says .
we have recently dispursed $ 130m to help ongoing programmes in the region .
we believe the spillover from ebola is limited , but we will continue to monitor the situation , she adds .

documents.title: imf : ecb 's asset purchase scheme can make a difference
text: what 's does the imf think about the european central bank 's plan to buy asset-backed securities ( bundles of loans to small firms ) ?
chief economist olivier blanchard says : we believe it can make a difference .
one problem in the eurozone , he says , is the poor supply of credit to small firms .
a good , healthy abs market would be useful we believe the ecb programme can help by developing that market , he adds .
another question on ukraine .
the imf hopes that there will be an easing '' of tensions soon , that would allow a bounceback next year .
but for 2014 it expects a sharp contraction , although not as bad as other authorities have predicted .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) for the first time in ages the imf has left its forecasts for uk economic growth unchanged .
once bitten ?
what is that imf 's view of the egyptian economy ?
not much change since april , it 's still a difficult situation .

documents.title: imf on russia , and germany
text: what is the imf 's view of the impact of the ukraine crisis on russia 's economy ?
the sanctions have made a difficult situation worse , says the imf 's thomas helbling .
looking forward , we do n't expect any fast change on that situation to make russia a more attractive place to invest .
and germany ?
there are suggestions that germany 's confidence has been hit we 'll need to see the next investment figures for more detail , helbling adds .

documents.title: blanchard : world may not get back to pre-crisis growth rates
text: olivier blanchard is taking questions now .

guardian economics editor larry elliott asks whether the imf believes the world economy is stuck in a 'secular stagnation ' , or is it simply paying the price for borrowing growth from the future in the run-up to the crisis .
blanchard says that he agrees that potential growth is lower than in the early years of the last decade .
the evidence is there '' .
whether we can get back to those previous levels , we do n't know yet .
there is a risk that we do n't .
but he 's less convinced by the argument that interest rates need to be maintained at record low levels for the foreseeable future , to stoke up demand .

documents.title: imf 's three risks : search for yield , geopolitics , the eurozone
text: olivier blanchard is identifying three key risks : 1 ) the search for yield '' in the financial markets , after years of low interest rates , may have stoked up risks for the future .
2 ) geopolitical risks have become more relevant '' .
the imf reckons that the ukraine crisis has not ( yet ) had measurable effects beyond the affected countries and their immediate neighbours .
and the middle east turmoil has not ( yet ) driven up oil prices .
but the dangers are there 3 ) the risk is a stalling of the recovery in the euro area , dragging it into deflation .
the imf has cut its forecast for emerging market economies .
blanchard says : for emerging market economies as a whole , potential growth is now forecast to be 1.5 % lower than it was in 2011 .
blanchard says that while japan 's economy s growing , its high public debt and very low potential growth rate '' is a major macroeconomic and fiscal challenges '' .
japan 's debt/gdp ratio is now over 200 % , so very hard to reduce without strong growth

documents.title: imf 's blanchard : us and uk lead the way as eurozone lags
text: over in washington , imf chief economist olivier blanchard is presenting the world economic outlook now ( live feed here ) .
blanchard says that the headline estimate for global growth disguises the fact that some countries have recovered or nearly recovered .
but others are still struggling '' .

great britain and america are leading the way , blanchard says , with a serious caveat : among advanced countries , the united states and the united kingdom in particular are leaving the financial crisis behind and achieving decent growth .
even for them however , potential growth is lower than it was in the early 2000s .
but he singles out the eurozone as a laggard : growth in the euro area nearly stalled earlier this year , even in the core .
while this reflects in part temporary factors , both legacies , primarily in the south , and low potential growth , nearly everywhere , are playing a role in slowing down the recovery
the new world economic outlook is packed with charts - my colleague julia kollewe has pulled together some important ones , here : imf downgrades global growth forecasts - the key charts
the imf is also warning that the world economy might never return to the pace of expansion seen before the financial crisis .

from washington , economics editor larry elliott writes : in its flagship half-yearly world economic outlook , the fund said the failure of countries to recover strongly from the worst recession of the post-war era meant there was a risk of stagnation or persistently weak activity .
the imf said it expected global growth to be 3.3 % in 2014 , 0.4 points lower than it was predicting in the april weo and 0.1 points down on interim forecasts made in july .
a up in the rate of expansion to 3.8 % is forecast for 2015 , down from 3.9 % in the april weo and 4 % in july .
but the fund highlighted the risk that its predictions would once again be too optimistic .
the pace of global recovery has disappointed in recent years '' , the imf said , noting that since 2010 it had been consistently forced to revise down its forecasts .
with weaker-than-expected global growth for the first half of 2014 and increased downside risks , the projected in growth may again fail to materialise or fall short of expectation . ''
here 's larry 's full story : imf says economic growth may never return to pre-crisis levels
the imf also reckons that the uk will outperform the rest of europe , with 3.2 % in 2014 , dropping to 2.7 % in 2015 .
szu ping chan ( @ szupingc ) imf expects uk to remain on top of g7 this year , with growth of 3.2pc despite `` weak and uneven '' global recovery .

documents.title: imf cuts growth forecasts
text: breaking news : the international monetary fund has cut its growth forecasts , and warned that the world economy might never return to the pace of expansion seen before the financial crisis .
the imf now expects world growth to be 3.3 % in 2014 , down 0.1 % from its july forecast , and 3.8 % in 2015 , down 0.2 % from three month ago .
it warns that an uneven global recovery continues '' , and admits that the pace of the global recovery has disappointed in recent years .
in its new world economic outlook , just released , the imf also warns that the markets are underpricing risk , and that geopolitical risks have increased .
it says : financial markets have been optimistic , with higher equity prices , compressed spreads , and very low volatility .

however , this has not translated into a in investment , which and there are concerns that markets are underpricing risk , not fully internalizing the uncertainties surrounding the macroeconomic outlook and their implications for the pace of withdrawal of monetary stimulus in some major advanced economies .
geopolitical tensions have risen .
so far their macroeconomic effects appear mostly confined to the regions involved , but there are tangible risks of more widespread disruptions lots more detail and reaction to follow

documents.title: watch the imf 's press conference here
text: the imf will hold a press conference conference to discuss its new world economic outlook at 2pm bst ( 9am in washington ) .
it 's being streamed live , here ( right-click to open in a new tab ) .
heads-up in 15 minutes time the international monetary fund will release its latest world economic outlook , over in washington .
brace yourselves for new growth forecasts , charts , predictions on the state of the world economy

documents.title: profit warning at sodastream
text: ouch .
fizz purveyor sodastream has warned that revenues in the third quarter are below expectations , due to weaker-than-expected demand in the us .
ceo daniel birnbaum did n't sweeten the pill , admitting that : we are very disappointed in our recent performance .
shares in sodastream , the israeli company which operates a factory in the palestinian west bank , are expected to tumble around 16 % when wall street opens .

elsewhere in the square mile , bloomberg is reporting that dutch financial group rabobank has suspended two london-based foreign exchange traders , after an internal investigation into their dealings .
new rules that could see senior bankers jailed appear to have prompted two senior executives at hsbc 's uk arm to leave .

reuters has the story : two directors of hsbc 's british business are set to leave the bank because they are unhappy with new rules that can result in jail sentences for senior bankers , a source familiar with the matter said .

alan thomson , a member of the audit and risk committees of hsbc bank plc , has tendered his resignation from the bank and john trueman , the deputy chairman of hsbc bank plc , is on the verge of resigning , the source said .
sky news reported on tuesday that the likely departures of both men were a direct consequence of new proposals to strengthen accountability for senior bankers .
the bank of england , and the financial conduct authority , announced in late july that bankers would be criminally liable if their reckless led to a bank failing .
the new rules , which could come into force next year , would also force bankers to prove they had acted appropriately .
new tough tests on competence , personal conduct and ethical behaviour for top bankers are also planned .

bob rice , managing partner at new york-based tangent capital , reckons the slump in german industrial production is tied in with the weak inflation across europe ( which creates less demand for new goods ) bob rice ( @ bobrice3 ) ugly chart of german industrial production , via quartz .
ez deflation drums getting pretty loud .
this morning 's weak german industrial data is the latest in a series of worrying signals .
as this chart shows , the monthly pmi reports ( which measure activity in the sector ) have also shown a slowdown in recent months .
chris williamson ( @ williamsonchris ) recession worries in # germany as # manufacturing falls at sharpest rate since financial crisis

documents.title: summary : german recession fears grow
text: time to catch-up .
economists fear that germany is sliding into recession , after industrial production across europe 's largest economy tumbled by an alarming 4.0 % in august , compared with july .
it 's the biggest monthly fall since the aftermath of lehman brothers ' collapse reverberated through the global economy .
carsten brzeski of ing warned that it is too early to tell '' whether germany will avoid a technical recession .
and even if it does , the remaining months of 2014 look very challenging .
berenberg bank cautioned that a mild recession '' can not be ruled out .

reaction starts here german industrial output , to august 2014 the german economy ministry itself said that the industrial production is currently going through a weak phase '' , with output of heavy duty machinery tumbling by almost 9 % .
august 's weak reading partly due to summer holidays being later than usual .
but even accounting for that , the german economy could be in trouble .
ralph solveen , economist at commerzbank , says ( via the ft ) : the trend is pointing down , with the german economy in the third quarter likely to have stagnated at best . ''
here 's the full story : german recession fears grow with latest industry data the euro continued to slide in the foreign exchange markets ; now down 0.5 % against the us dollar at $ 1.2587 .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) eur continuing lower liquidity continuing to be poor .
new data has also shown that britain 's industrial sector slowed in august .
manufacturing output grew by just 0.1 % , and industrial production was flat overall .

rob wood , chief uk economist at german bank berenberg , believes tensions between russia and the west over ukraine are hurting the uk industrial based : uk manufacturing is entering a soft patch as the fall-out from events in ukraine spreads .
ukraine and russia are of little direct importance to uk exporters .
but the manufacturing cycle is highly integrated across countries .

that means the decline in business confidence and german manufacturing output triggered by russia 's aggression in eastern ukraine will continue to spread to the uk over the second half of the year . ''
full story : uk manufacturing growth up just 0.1 % in august in other news europe 's stock markets have all fallen today , driven down by the weak german data and geopolitical tensions .
round-up .
spain 's ibex is down 1.5 % , following the news that a nurse in madrid had become the first person to contract ebola outside africa .
shares in mining giant rio tinto have surged 5 % after it revealed it had rejected takeover overtures from rival glencore .
tesco has suspended a fifth executive , as the probe into how it overstated its profits by £ 250m continues .
and the bank of england has predicted that a price war could break out in the uk mortgage market , after lenders saw a sharp drop in loan availability over the summer .
more here : mortgage price war expected as uk lenders fight for market share

documents.title: european market update
text: the slowdown in uk manufacturing growth in august ( details ) has n't helped the sentiment in the financial markets .
all europe 's main stock indices are in the red , as traders absorb the warning that germany could be falling into recession .
here 's the situation : european stock markets , morning , september 7 2014 reuters the us market is expected to follow suit this afternoon , with the dow being called down 82 ppints .

joao monteiro , analyst at valutrades , explains : wall street is eyeing a weaker start to the day 's trade , both off the back of this lead from asia but also given what appears to be a deteriorating geopolitical situation .
the ebola crisis continues to spread , whilst the fact islamic state is now active on the syrian/turkish border is also significant cause for concern .
in other news this morning , tesco has suspended its fifth executive as the investigation into its £ 250m profit mis-statement continues .
it 's understood to be group commercial director kevin grace .
tesco suspends another executive after profits debacle
my colleague simon bowers tweets : simon bowers ( @ sbowers00 ) breaking : a senior banker from leading uk bank pleads guilty to libor fixing conspiracy charge brought by sfo .
not named for legal reasons

mike rigby , head of manufacturing at barclays , warns that the uk factory recovery is fragile : the slowdown in growth levels should not mask the reality that the manufacturing sector continues to grow although at a far more restrained level than we witnessed in the first half of the year .

however , although there is still an optimistic outlook amongst manufacturers helped by easing price pressures in the sector , there is a fragility to the recovery which needs a powerful shot in the arm from both a boost in export orders as well as more investment in new product development and process enhancements . ''

documents.title: uk manufacturing growth slows - reaction starts here
text: britain 's factory sector appears to have lost momentum , says howard archer of ihs global insight , following the meagre 0.1 % rise in manufacturing output in august .
geopolitics , and the troubles in europe , are to blame , he reckons : weak eurozone activity is clearly having a limiting impact on foreign demand for uk manufacturing goods .
the recent strength of the pound has not helped uk manufacturing exports .
in addition , it is possible that current heightened geopolitical tensions and the weakness in the eurozone is increasing business caution and causing some orders to be delayed or even cancelled .
and this chart , also from today 's uk production report , shows how industrial output in all major economies is still smaller than before the financial crisis began .
uk industrial production , vs g7 , august 2014 output in italy and france remained 23.4 % ( ! ! )
below respective pre- downturn levels , according to the office for national statistics , while the us remained 0.5 % shy of its 08-09 peak , the full report is here .
this chart shows how britain 's industrial sector was hit hard by the great recession : uk production & manufacturing , 2004-2014

documents.title: uk industrial output flat in august
text: here we go uk factory output was flat in august , down from 0.5 % growth the previous month .
it 's another sign that global manufacturing slowed over the summer ; but also rather better than germany 's 4 % slump .
output in the narrower uk manufacturing sector inched up by 0.1 % month-on-month , down from 0.3 % growth in july , according to new data from the office for national statistics .
uk industrial production , to august 2014 on an annual basis , uk industrial output was 2.5 % higher in august 2014 than august 2013 , with manufacturing growing by 3.9 % .
so it 's not been a bad 12 months for industry but , the data also show that britain 's manufacturing base has still not recovered its pre-crisis levels .
production output is still 9.6 % lower than the peak in 2008 , and manufacturing was 4.4 % lower .
more to follow
european stock markets have fallen following today 's weak german factory data .
the german dax and french cac are both down around 0.7 % , with the ftse 100 down 35 points or -0.5 % ( despite mining rallying ) .
ok , it 's nearly time to find out how britain 's factories fared in august .
the uk industrial output data is due at 9.30am bst , and will show if manufacturers here shared germany 's struggles .
economists predict that industrial output was flat month-on-month , having grown by 0.5 % in july

documents.title: phillip inman : germany has opposed investment for growth
text: phillip inman , the guardian 's economics correspondent , reminds us that germany has already rebuffed calls to increase government investment spending to boost the economy and drive growth in the eurozone .

inman says : last week the international monetary fund ( imf ) singled out berlin for falling behind on infrastructure spending in a report that argued well targeted investments can pay back three times the initial cost .

imf urges greater infrastructure spending after 30-year decline us treasury secretary jack lew has also urged germany to lead the eurozone out of its current morass with extra spending , especially as the government has boasted of its budget surplus .

but finance minister wolfgang schäuble has consistently rebuffed these calls , rejecting keynesian policies to boost higher public spending in germany and elsewhere in europe in favour of painful structural reforms .
we must n't allow ourselves to entertain the illusion that we can solve our problems using more and more public funds and ever higher deficits , '' he said .
calls in europe to use ever more public funds and higher deficits and debts are misleading .
growth and jobs are not created through ever higher deficits - otherwise we would have no problems now . ''

the problem for schäuble is that he has also rejected further stimulus by the european central bank , telling its president mario draghi that europe 's banks are awash with cheap cash , making any plans for quantitative easing irrelevant . ''
more reaction adam black ( @ adambla27986197 ) german industrial production shocks with biggest fall since 2009 - down by 4 % .
long the engine of europe 's growth , now looking v weak .
greg mckenna ( @ gregorymckenna ) this is becoming a train wreck - german industrial production plunges ( via @ twitterid )
you can see this morning 's alarming germany 's industrial output data here , on the destatis website .
it explains how the 4 % slide in production was driven by an 8.8 % drop in the manufacturer of 'capital goods ' ( big-ticket items like machinery and cars ) .
production of intermediate goods ( used to make other finished products ) fell by 1.9 % .
consumer goods production fell by 0.4 % , and construction production was down by 2.0 % .

documents.title: czech industrial output drops too
text: germany is n't alone new data from the czech republic shows that its factory production also fell in august .
czech industrial output shrank by 3.6 % month-on-month in august , and was 5.2 % lower than the year before .
car production was down by 13.4 % year-on-year .
sky news business ( @ skynewsbiz ) german industrial production dropped sharply in august , weighed down by falling manufacturing and construction output

documents.title: berenberg : german recession can not be ruled out
text: analysts at berenberg bank have warned that the the 4 % tumble in german industrial output in august may indicate that europe 's largest economy is being dragged into recession that echoes ing 's warning earlier this morning .

berenberg say : even if the decline in business confidence triggered by russia 's aggression in eastern ukraine were to end in the coming months , we can not even rule out a mild recession on the back of this data .
a significant rebound in manufacturing , and thus investment , is unlikely to come through before early 2015 .

reminder , german 's economy shrank by 0.2 % in april-june quarter , so it 's halfway into a technical recession berenberg also point out that the german school holidays started later than usual this year .
that meant more people would have been on vacation in august , encouraging factories to shut down then rather than in july ( when production rose 1.6 % ) .
so there are seasonal factors to consider here .
the bmw 3-series production line at the bmw factory in munich , germany .
villagran/getty images

documents.title: takeover fever sends rio shares up 5 %
text: in the city , shares in rio tinto soared by over 5 % in early trading , following the news that it rejected a takeover approach from rival miner glencore in august .
shares in anglo american , another mining giant , are up 2 % as investors anticipate an outbreak of takeover activity in the sector .
ryan chilcote ( @ ryanchilcote ) rio tinto 's shares just jumped 6 % on news of glencore 's interest in a merger .
that 's rio 's biggest jump in 2 months
looking at the detail of the german industrial output data production of new cars slumped by over 25 % month-on-month in august .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) german ip - motor vehicles .
# oneoffornot
monthly factory output can be volatile .

but as this chart shows , germany 's factory production had been bobbing around between +2 % and -2 % for the last couple of years , until august soberlook.com ( @ soberlook ) chart : really ugly drop in german industrial production ( m/m ) -
the euro has lost ground since the german industrial output data was released ; down 0.2 % against the us dollar at $ 1.2624 .

documents.title: german industrial output tumbles - what the experts say
text: analysts are stunned by the 4 % slump in german industrial production in august .

carsten brzeski of ing says that geopolitical tensions , and the summer slowdown , proved a dangerous combination : such a shocking number normally leads to two possible reactions : either an outcry of shock , or just denying the numbers due to monthly volatility or one-offs .
looking at the german numbers , the truth is probably somewhere in the middle .
the sharp drop in august could at least be partly driven by the vacation period .
however , the drop is too strong to explain it by one-offs .
this means that increased uncertainty but also real slowing of the eurozone economy , eastern european economies and emerging markets are all currently taking their toll on the german economy .
brzeski went on to warn that germany could have slid into recession ( it contracted by 0.2 % in the second quarter of 2014 ) , and the outlook is difficult '' .
looking beyond the third quarter , the german industry is looking into a more difficult future .
the safety net of inventories and orders at hand has narrowed in recent months .
inventory build-up combined with dropping new orders does not bode well for industrial production in the fourth quarter .
carsten brzeski ( @ carstenbrzeski ) another shocker .
german ip drops by 4 % mom in august .
that hurts '' , tweets frederik ducrozet of credit agricole : frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) ouch .
german ip down by 4.0 % mom in august .
high volatility due to holiday in particular , but still .
# dastutweh frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) german ip now down by 1.1 % in q3 ( after -1.5 % qoq in q2 ) .

huge jump required in sept. and duncan weldon , economics correspondent at the bbc 's newsnight , agrees that the news from germany is worrying : duncan weldon ( @ duncanweldon ) grim factory orders yesterday , grim industrial production today - german economy definitely slowing .

documents.title: german industrial output tumbles at fastest rate since early 2009
text: serious news out of germany this morning - industrial output across europe 's economic powerhouse has tumbled at a pace not seen in five and a half-years .
german industrial output fell by 4.0 % month-on-month in august , according to data just released by the economy ministry .
that 's the biggest fall since early 2009 , and much worse than the lowest estimates from economists .
it adds to fears that the eurozone economy is weakening .
germany is also feeling the impact of the sanctions between the west and russia over the ukraine crisis..
the ministry said that the slump in output was partly due to summer holidays but there 's not doubt that germany 's factory sector is suffering .
in a statement , it said : industrial production is currently going through a weak phase but the current decline is exacerbated by holiday effects . ''
all in all , one should expect weak production for the third quarter as a whole . ''
it 's the second piece of bad german economic data in as many days - yesterday we learned that industrial orders slumped by 5.7 % in august , suggesting leaner times ahead .
that fall was also the biggest since 2009 frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) `` drops most since 2009 '' is the new black .
reaction to follow

documents.title: the agenda : imf to release new growth forecast
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the world economy , the financial markets , business and the eurozone .
today 's big story will be the international monetay fund 's new world economic outlook , released at 2pm bst ( or 9am washington ) .
the imf will release its new economic forecasts , and early leaks have suggested that it will cut some growth estimates .

in particular , germany 's growth rate for this year and 2015 could be trimmed back : imf cuts german growth estimates to 1.5 % also coming up today the mining sector is aflutter , after rio tinto announced overnight that it had rejected a takeover approach from glencore .
both companies shares jumped on the australian stock market .
it 's been a busy day down under - the australian central bank has left interest rates unchanged , and hinted that they could stay unchanged for a while .

reserve bank leaves interest rates on hold at 2.5 % despite falling dollar sky news business ( @ skynewsbiz ) australia 's central bank leaves interest rates on hold for the 13th-straight period , hinting it would stay at record low 2.5 % for some time economic data-wise , we get the latest uk industrial production data for august at 9.30am - that 'll show how british factories fared over the summer .
and at 3pm bst the niesr think-tank will give its new estimate for uk growth in the third quarter of this year .
and , as usual , we 'll have an eye on greece , where the government has called a vote of confidence for next week in a bid to ward off an early election
